subtitle: Hello, I’m Jeffrey Mishlove, and today I’m
going to talk about “The Law of
Revelation.” This is the fourth cosmic law
enunciated by Dean and Wendy Brown in
their book on Cosmic Law. For those
of you who have been following this
series of discussions on the cosmic laws
of Dean and Wendy Brown, it’s probably
useful to say at the outset that these
are not like the laws of physics. They’re
really more like principles. You may
recall, the second of these was The Law
of Progressive Contraries. So, because the
previous law that I discussed was The
Law of Concealment,
doesn’t it make sense to you now that
there ought to be an opposite of
concealment, a contrary of concealment?
That’s what we’re looking at, The Law
of Revelation: “That which has been
concealed will be revealed.” It’s
interesting to consider just how this
revelation takes place. How many great
discoveries came out of dreams?
Certainly, if you’ve been following this
series, you’ll know that a number of
life-changing discoveries for me came
out of my dreams, or what my friend,
Stephan Schwartz, would call “non-local
mind.” The mind that is not localized
inside of your skull, but we have access
to it.
Think of the great mathematical
discoveries of Ramanujan that, according
to him, came because he worshiped the
goddess. Think of Thomas Edison. Now,
Thomas Edison is interesting, he’s a very
interesting case. He was, incidentally, a
student of Theosophy and the teachings
of Madame Blavatsky. When he invented
the light bulb, it’s well-known that he
experimented tediously with something
like 3,000 different kinds of filaments
before he came upon the tungsten
filament, which is used primarily
in incandescent light bulbs today.
Although, I know we’re in an era in which
the light bulb itself, the incandescent
light bulb, is going out of fashion in
favor of light-emitting diodes. But the
point is, that was a question of sweat-
labor – 3,000 filaments until you
come up with the right one. Humans
are quite capable of engaging in the
process of discovery that way.
But,Thomas Edison also had a habit of
taking naps when he was in his
laboratory. He would take frequent
naps, and sometimes he’d be holding a
pencil in his hand while he was napping –
and when the pencil dropped to the floor
he would wake up out of that sleep. And
sometimes, right out of his dreams would
be the idea for another invention, fully
formed. That’s how, sometimes,
inventions occur. Nikola Tesla seemed to
receive most of his great inventions
fully formed, in the sense that he worked
with them in his mind. He would run scale
models of the invention, psychologically
in his mind, until he got them to work
perfectly. Then, when they were built
they worked well the very first time.
When I was president of The Intuition
Network, which I was for a period of some
fifteen years starting in 1993, I was funded
by a man named “Buck” Charlson. Well, his
name was Lynn Charlson, “Buck” was his
nickname, you could say. People loved to
call him “Buck.” I met him when he was
eighty-three years old. He was the inventor of the
hydraulic motor. Once again, it’s a
case of an invention that formed itself
in his subconscious mind. When he
built the first one it worked so well
that it remained in production for
decades and decades, probably still in
production without any major
modifications whatsoever. That’s different than the
inventions of Arthur Young, my mentor, who
invented the Bell helicopter. He worked
very hard. He spent, I don’t know, over a
decade working on a design that never
materialized, with rotors at the end of
the big helicopter rotors. It was a
faulty design. But eventually, because he
persisted, he came up with the Bell Model
47, the very first commercially licensed
helicopter, ever. So we see there are
different paths to revelation. Now, I’ve
talked in the previous segment on The
Law of Concealment, about how
parapsychological data is in plain sight
and yet it has been concealed for
150 years in the sense
that – I mean look at me, I’m the only
person in the world ever to receive a
doctoral degree in parapsychology, and
that was in 1980, nearly forty years ago.
That’s how marginalized, that’s how
obscure this field is. But, I’m gonna
tell you right now – I’m gonna make a
prediction for you, although none of us
will probably be alive at the time to
see its realization – but the day will
come when parapsychology, very much the
way I’m conceiving it and describing it
to you here in these videos, is not going
to be a science on the very fringes, on
the very margins of society. No,
civilization will be organized around
the data of parapsychology. That’s my
vision, that’s my promise. The Law of
Revelation suggests that that is
inevitable. The pendulum is going to
swing back in this direction. We are
going to see a science – a global science –
in which parapsychology is the core, the
foundational science
of all. It may not be called
parapsychology, but what we’re talking
about is this mind-matter interface,
independent of the human nervous system.
That will become central. It may take a
thousand, two thousand, ten thousand years –
I can’t tell you exactly when. I expect
it will take a very long time,
considering how incredibly marginalized
this science is today. But, it might be a
shorter time, it might be a hundred years,
it might be fifty years. It’s hard to say,
because things change so rapidly. But it
will happen, and that would be an
example of The Law of Revelation
manifesting itself. Of course, you can
read science fiction stories today about
other worlds in which it’s already
happened. So, in that sense it’s
inevitable – it will happen here. At
the same time, we’ll have a much deeper
knowledge of the human psyche. We won’t
be hiding from ourselves so much, and
we’ll be able to address many of the
terrible conundrums that exist now
preventing parapsychology from achieving
its full potential. One that I
enunciated not long ago in the “In
Presence” series is how – given that we all
have probably a modicum of psychokinetic
ability – are we using that ability to
suppress other people’s ESP because we
don’t want them to read our mind and to
know our secrets? So, it will be a very
different world with regard to privacy
and secrecy and the idea that we can
hide things from other people and hide
them from ourselves. But that day is
coming, eventually. I imagine there
are some people out there who are hoping
it will be a very, very long
time from now. What other secrets might
be revealed? Well, let me ask you now: How
does this relate to you: revelation? What
would you like to have revealed to
yourself? What knowledge has been eluding
you, has been concealed from you that you
would like to have revealed? Are you
willing to allow your consciousness, your
non-local consciousness, to allow that
information to ease into your conscious
awareness? Are you willing to be the
subject of a revelation, perhaps even
today – a revelation? I’ll leave you with
that thought. Thank you for being
with me.
